first_reading.title: Book of Genesis
first_reading.text:
[[Gn 17,3]]When Abram prostrated himself, God spoke to him:
[[Gn 17,4]]"My covenant with you is this: you are to become the father of a host of nations.
[[Gn 17,5]]No longer shall you be called Abram; your name shall be Abraham, for I am making you the father of a host of nations.
[[Gn 17,6]]I will render you exceedingly fertile; I will make nations of you; kings shall stem from you.
[[Gn 17,7]]I will maintain my covenant with you and your descendants after you throughout the ages as an everlasting pact, to be your God and the God of your descendants after you.
[[Gn 17,8]]I will give to you and to your descendants after you the land in which you are now staying, the whole land of Canaan, as a permanent possession; and I will be their God."
[[Gn 17,9]]God also said to Abraham: "On your part, you and your descendants after you must keep my covenant throughout the ages.

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 105,4]]Look to the LORD in his strength; 
seek to serve him constantly.
[[Ps 105,5]]Recall the wondrous deeds that he has wrought, 
his portents, and the judgments he has uttered.

[[Ps 105,6]]You descendants of Abraham, his servants, 
sons of Jacob, his chosen ones!
[[Ps 105,7]]He, the LORD, is our God; 
throughout the earth his judgments prevail.

[[Ps 105,8]]He remembers forever his covenant 
which he made binding for a thousand generations.
[[Ps 105,9]]Which he entered into with Abraham 
and by his oath to Isaac.

gospel.text:
[[Jn 8,51]]Jesus said to the Jews: "Amen, amen, I say to you, whoever keeps my word will never see death."
[[Jn 8,52]](So) the Jews said to him, "Now we are sure that you are possessed. Abraham died, as did the prophets, yet you say, 'Whoever keeps my word will never taste death.'
[[Jn 8,53]]Are you greater than our father Abraham, who died? Or the prophets, who died? Who do you make yourself out to be?"
[[Jn 8,54]]Jesus answered, "If I glorify myself, my glory is worth nothing; but it is my Father who glorifies me, of whom you say, 'He is our God.'
[[Jn 8,55]]You do not know him, but I know him. And if I should say that I do not know him, I would be like you a liar. But I do know him and I keep his word.
[[Jn 8,56]]Abraham your father rejoiced to see my day; he saw it and was glad.
[[Jn 8,57]]So the Jews said to him, "You are not yet fifty years old and you have seen Abraham?"
[[Jn 8,58]]Jesus said to them, "Amen, amen, I say to you, before Abraham came to be, I AM."
[[Jn 8,59]]So they picked up stones to throw at him; but Jesus hid and went out of the temple area.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
